page.title: 11Industry in Wootton Bassett
page.content: Until recently most of the industries in Wootton Bassett have been connected with the farming activities around the town. The largest employer is the{St.Ivel} creamery in Station Rd. which employs 520 people making dairy products and bottling milk. This factory includes the largest yogurt making plant in Britain. On the south west edge of the town{British Lely}manufacture farm machinery ranging from hedge cutters to combined harvesters.Forty eight people are employed.{Small firms}make packing cases(G&P Cases) & tarpaulins and ropes(Mudfords).At the site of the old station{Johnsons Aggregates}have a stone depot,distributing limestone brought by train from The Mendips. This year{IBM}have announced plans to build a micro-electronics factory on a new industrial estate near Woodshaw.
